Package io.micronaut.annotation.processing

@Internal package io.micronaut.annotation.processing
This package contains the Annotation processors that power Micronaut. Classes within this package are considered internal and should not be referenced from application code.
Since:
1.0
Author:
graemerocher
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    io.micronaut.annotation.processing.test
     
    io.micronaut.annotation.processing.visitor
    This package contains Visitor pattern elements for Annotation processing.

    Description
    AggregatingTypeElementVisitorProcessor
    The annotation processed used to execute type element visitors.
    AnnotationProcessingOutputVisitor
    An implementation of ClassWriterOutputVisitor for annotation processing.
    AnnotationUtils
    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    No longer needed
    BeanDefinitionInjectProcessor
    The core annotation processor used to generate bean definitions and power AOP for Micronaut.
    ConfigurationMetadataProcessor
    Handles Configuration metadata generation.
    GenericUtils
    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    No longer needed
    JavaAnnotationMetadataBuilder
    A AnnotationMetadata for builder for Java to be used at compile time.
    JavaElementAnnotationMetadataFactory
    Java element annotation metadata factory.
    JavaNativeElementsHelper
    The Java native element helper.
    ModelUtils
    Provides utility method for working with the annotation processor AST.
    PackageConfigurationInjectProcessor
    An annotation processor that generates BeanConfiguration implementations for each package annotated with Configuration.
    PostponeToNextRoundException
    Exception to indicate postponing processing to next round.

    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    No longer used

    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    No longer used
